content.description:
JAPANESE FUMI-E (“STEPPING-ON PICTURE”), A TYPE OF METAL PLATE CARVED WITH CHRISTIAN IMAGERY, USED BY THE JAPANESE GOVERNMENT TO IDENTIFY SUSPECTED CHRISTIANS, CIRCA 1630

Heritage Images / Contributor

Japanese authorities required suspected Japanese Christians to tread on fumi-e plates based on the belief that Christians would refuse to disrespect images of Jesus Christ and other Christian religious figures.
content.question: In the late nineteenth century, Japanese attitudes toward European cultural influences changed as a direct result of

choices.label: Japan isolating its economy from trade with Western markets
Japan enacting political reforms during the Meiji Era
Japan defeating China in the First Sino-Japanese War
Japan extending its empire over most of Southeast Asia

content.answer: Japan enacting political reforms during the Meiji Era
